name: Avoid having inline control statements (PHP)
description:
This rule searches for all the artifacts having inline control statements. The Control statements being checked including "if", "else", "elseif", "for", "while", "foreach". 
Even if intention is to execute only one statement for the given condition, the statement should be put inside curly braces as a good practice.
output:
This report lists all the Artifacts having inline control statements

This QR provides the following information:
Artifact full name.
rationale: Using curly braces with the control statements increases readability and decreases the likelihood of logical errors being introduced when new code lines are added.
remediation: Use curly braces with the control statements even in situations where they are technically optional.
remediationSample:
<?php

if (1 === $variable2) {                 // violation removed
   echo '1';
} 
else if (2 === $variable2) {           // violation removed
   echo '2';
}
elseif (3 === $variable2) {           // violation removed
   echo '3';
}
else {                                // violation removed
   echo '4';
}

foreach(range(1, 5) as $i) {         //violation removed
   echo $i, PHP_EOL;
}

for ($i =1 ; $i < 5 ; $i++) {      // violation removed
   echo "hello cast" ;
}

$x = 1 ;
while ($x <= 5) {                 //violation removed
   echo "the number is : $x" ;
   $x++ ;
}
?>
